definition[0]: the main computer on a network, which controls all the others
definition[1]: one of the computers on a network that provides a special service
example[1]: All data is stored on a central file server.
definition[2]: the player who hits the ball to begin a game in tennis, volleyball etc
definition[3]: a special spoon for putting a particular type of food onto a plate
definition[4]: someone whose job is to bring you your food in a restaurant
definition[5]: a powerful computer used to store large amounts of information and to connect other smaller computers in a NETWORK. The smaller computers are sometimes called CLIENTs
example[3]: The network kept crashing because it was running on a file server without enough memory.
